titleStmt.title: Thomas Pennant to George Paton, on plans for Low's MS; requesting written materials and prints

additional.p: Pennant's unusual rendering of the year makes the date of this letter difficult to determine, though an unknown hand on the back of the sheet places it in 1774. The existence of a letter from Pennant to Paton dated January 10, 1773 (which makes reference to subjects discussed in adjacent correspondence), suggests that the current letter has been bound out of order, and was in fact written in 1774.

div.p: Accept first the best wishes for the season & next my best thanks for yr letters Decr 20th 30th & Jan.1. It will be great pleasure to hear of more of Mr Aulde’s antient tracts. be so good as to send me the rest of the Gabions; which I will keep till they come in use but that will be long, at present let us stick to our islands. Yr plan for Mr Low is excellent he will have great advantages with yr friend Mr Aberdeen.
Thanks for yr list of Prints. Ellenstalker & Daersie Castles will be acceptable.
Pray stop the magazines. favor me with account which I will discharge. I have not leisure to look into the numbers missing: but will next summer.
div.note: Pennant's letter to Paton on 14th February 1773 makes reference to an 'Edinburgh magazine', probably Ruddiman's Weekly Magazine, or, Edinburgh Amusement See also the note to Pennant's letter to Paton on 18th June 1773.
div.p: I heard from Mr Low this day. his plan for visiting the isles is most judicious: I write to him about it this post.
Yr account of miss Logie is very curious: it coincides much with a proof of long abstinence now in Wales.
div.closer:
I am Dear Sir Yr Obedt H S.Tho. Pennant.
Downing Jan. 9th 177¾
